title: The New Client
body:
It has much higher bandwith, in terms of the old one. I would use around 1-2 MB for 1 hour if the client just sat there and did nothing

New one uses around 20MB an hour just sitting there. seems rather high for a client.

(I have capped internet)

replies.body:
I hate this new client, don't fix what isn't broken. There was nothing wrong with old one that was JUST updated not that long ago.

Everything is way laggier, uglier and more annoying to navigate. Its like when your mum decides to move everything around the house and you now don't know where anything is, its the most annoying feeling. Ive never liked when a website has updated unless there was actually things wrong.

Why are they doing this exactly? I understanding adding new features but why do you have to jumble everything up.

Essentially the reason comes down to this:

> WILL THE UPDATED CLIENT USE ADOBE AIR?
Nope! The updated client is built from the ground up in what's called a web stack. This lets us add and support features way more easily. If you're interested, you can read up on the tech on our [engineering blog](https://engineering.riotgames.com/news/architecture-league-client-update)

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/230175788-Updated-Client-Open-Beta-FAQ#h2q5

They also took the opportunity to overhaul the visuals, which personally I love way more than the legacy visuals, but to each their own.

As for things being hard to find, I found that once I got used to where everything was it was generally much more intuitive than the legacy client, which makes a better experience for new players and shouldn't take too much getting used to for old ones.
Why does the new client not let me play featured gamemodes? even if a friend invites me using the old client
The new client takes up too much of my screen. It looks good though.
In settings you can change the resolution of the client to make it smaller.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=LRgFO7Tl,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-11-11T12:29:39.344+0000)
>
> In settings you can change the resolution of the client to make it smaller.

I only have one option. My native resolution is 1920 x 1080 but the client is like 1024 or something and I can't make it smaller, or larger. Not too big of a problem, just a minor inconvenience.
Huh, curious, I had 4 or 5 to choose from. I'll see if I can find some info for you.
Anyone else didn't get the Alpha Icon?
They haven't been distributed yet. Distribution will be between Nov 15th and Nov 29th.

Seems like the client doesn't minimize when you get into a game either. Seems to be using a lot more then it did before and with the horrible internet i have already im lagging constantly and having frame drops.

Edit seems like you are able to close the client once you get into game it fixes the issue but the client doesn't reopen when the game ends and you have to relog
